intro: Rhodosepala erecta, commonly known as the upright rhodosepala, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
